translated: The analysis of conditions is the analysis into kamma, etc.; the analysis of destiny is the analysis of the destinies as hell, etc., and as non-percipient beings, etc.; the analysis of species is the analysis of species as elephant, horse, etc., and as warrior, brahmin, etc.; the analysis of person is the analysis of the individualities of the various continua of beings; and the analysis of the physical basis is the analysis of the eye, etc., into an infinite number of different kinds. The analysis of the physical basis is the analysis of the heart- basis into an infinite number of different kinds. The analysis of the mind-base should be construed with the infinite analysis of the heart-basis, with the infinite analysis of the physical basis, with the infinite analysis of the object, and with the infinite analysis of the mode of progress, etc., and with the infinite analysis of the object, etc., as object. In this sutta, which is the vessel for the teaching, insight is stated. And the infinite analysis of the mind-base is stated by way of definition, taking cognizance of the consciousness that is to be penetrated by insight. Blue is similar to blue, and dissimilar to the other . So too with the profitable, etc., kinds. By means of the three-plane states as object: this is said with reference to the profitable, etc., kinds.

translated: The analysis of conditions is the analysis into kamma, etc.; the analysis of destiny is the analysis of destiny into hell, etc., and of the plane into the non-plane, etc.; the analysis of species is the analysis of species into elephant, horse, etc., and into warrior, brahmin, etc.; the analysis of individual is the analysis of individual into the individual of such and such a beingâ€™s continuum; and the analysis of the physical basis is the analysis of the physical basis of the eye, etc., which has already been stated as having an infinite number of divisions. The analysis of the mind-base should be construed as having an infinite number of divisions because of the physical basis of the heart, and because of the different kinds of painful and easy progress, etc., and because of the different kinds of object-predominance, etc. In this sutta-discourse the insight has been stated. And the mind-base has been stated as having eighty-nine divisions by way of indication, taking the consciousness that is the object of insight. Blue is similar to blue only, and dissimilar to any other. Likewise it should be construed in the case of the different kinds of profitable, etc., origination. By way of the states of the three planes: this was said with reference to the states of the eye, etc., which have already been stated as having an infinite number of divisions by way of the object, the state, the aspect, and the mode of progress, etc., of the states of the three planes.

translated: The word â€œrebirth-linkingâ€ is to be understood as a verbal noun formed by the addition of a nominal affix to denote the act of giving, in the sense of â€œit gives rebirth-linking,â€ and so on. Herein, that which is conascent with kamma gives rebirth-linking; that which is not conascent with kamma but is a companion to kamma leads to rebirth-linking. Both kinds bring about rebirth again and again. That is why it is said, â€œIt is a giver of rebirth-linking, etc.,â€ and â€œIt is only what gives rebirth-linking.â€ğŸ”½

translated: The word â€œrebirth-linkingâ€ should be seen as a verbal noun formed from the verb â€œto giveâ€ (deti) in the sense of â€œgiving rebirth-linkingâ€ . The word â€œrebirth-linkingâ€ is formed in the sense of â€œgiving rebirth-linkingâ€ in the way in which the word â€œsugar-eaterâ€ is formed in the sense of â€œhaving the habit of eating sugarâ€ . The word â€œrebirth-linkingâ€ is formed in the way stated in the sense of â€œgiving rebirth-linkingâ€ by the addition of the suffix -aka, which has the characteristic of denoting â€œdiversityâ€ or â€œdistinctionâ€ . Herein, the kamma that is conascent with the rebirth-linking consciousness gives rebirth-linking, and the kamma that is not conascent with it but is a condition for it by way of decisive support gives rebirth-linking by causing the occurrence of rebirth-linking. Both kinds of kamma cause rebirth-linking by producing rebirth in the various kinds of becoming again and again. That is why it is said, â€œIt is the giver of rebirth-linking, tooâ€ , and so on. It is only the kamma that gives rebirth-linking that is called â€œrebirth-linkingâ€ because it is similar to the result, that is, rebirth-linking, and because it is the cause of it. So it is called â€œrebirth-linkingâ€ in the way that a tree is called a â€œmangoâ€ because it is similar to the mango fruit and is the cause of it. The kamma that does not give rebirth-linking is not called â€œrebirth-linkingâ€ in this way. Herein, kamma that is to be experienced in the present becomes kamma that is to be experienced here since it is kamma that is to be experienced in this becoming.
